definition: to mount a sneak attack/to raid
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: They are almost always able to sneak up on their unprepared victims twinkle-toed.

sentences.english: Can the encampment have already sent out to bellow a voice, obviously sneak attack already quick one step start.

sentences.english: Orders were received that we should make a night march and beat up the enemy's quarters.

sentences.english: He sent out scouts as well, to make certain no enemy took them unawares.
sentences.chinese: 他還派出了巡邏隊，以確保沒有敵人能偷襲他們。

sentences.english: MacDonald's in Tokyo is terrible revenge for Pearl Harbour. - S. I Hayakawa.

sentences.chinese: 偷襲珍珠港是一次具有毀滅性的遭難。

sentences.english: The little village was swept down by the enemy.

sentences.english: The air force surprised the harbor at dawn.

sentences.english: In LiBiao relax vigilance, LinZhenHai sneak attack, and it will LiBiao stun.

sentences.english: As I know he will certainly ambush me, I attacked him first.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他肯定會偷襲我，於是我先動手打了他。

definition: to encircle and annihilate/refers to repeated campaigns of the Guomindang against the communists from 1930 onwards
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
